intro: Knappia verna, commonly known as the spring bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and woodland edges, preferring partial shade. Knappia verna has slender, hairy stems and produces small, clustered flowers in early spring. It is often found in temperate climates and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
